alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 3:23AM PDT until March 25 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches above 2000 feet. * WHERE...Jackson County above 2000 feet, including portions of I- 5 south of Ashland, portions of State Route 238 between Jacksonville and Applegate, and portions of Highway 62 between Trail and Prospect and including the cities of Prospect and Butte Falls. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute this morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Roads will remain wet in snow showers into this evening. The best chance for snow to accumulate on roads will be during the night, especially in heavier showers after midnight tonight until 9 AM PDT Saturday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
